JOB.TITLE: Geotechnical Engineer - large international Consultantcy
JOB.DESCRIPTION: Leading design consultancy reqs mid to senior Geotechnical engineer with Roads, Freeway, Highway, Rail or similar project exp
JOB.ADDETAILS:
Leading consultancy requires a Geotechnical engineer with around 5-20 years experience to work on various infrastructure projects.
  • Geotechnical Engineers - Degree qualified
  • 5-20 years experience and previously held an active role in design, investigation and management of materials testing
  • Foundation investigations relating to building structures, bridges, Tunnelling infrastructure projects etc
  • Assessments of slope stability relating to soil and rock slopes, cuts and embankments
  • Familiar with all associated standards and Quality Assurance
  • Review of geotechnical and geomaterials conditions
  • In some instance over viewing engineering and technical staff in geotechnical and materials engineering.
  • Good liaison and communication skills, working with other discipline engineers and clients
  • Strong team environment and friendly office
  • $90 -140k Salary package, negotiable as based on experience


If you are looking for a career change and to move into a large organisation that are only growing, and want a challenging role in a strong team environment . Please forward your full resume to David Lamb by email to david.lamb@command.com.au or call David or Hannah on 02 9262 5656.

Otherwise apply below

JOB.TITLE: Civil/Structural Project Engineer - Mobile phone towers/sites
JOB.DESCRIPTION: Industrial steelwork or previous Tower project design/construct exp for mobile phone Telco project sites based in QLD, & NSW
JOB.ADDETAILS:
Leading communication infrastructure design company requires to recruit Project Engineers .  You will preferbly have around 4 -10 years Civil structural or Mechanical engineer expereince and hold a degree qualification. You would be required to work on new and ongoing telco tower design projects in rural and city sites, deal with design, buildings acquisition, property and manage sub contractors.    Previous expereince in project engineering and managing sub contractors in a similar industry  is required and Telco Tower design to construct projects would be preffered , but is not essential, but strong industrial site construction or design to site expereince is.    You would be working closely with design teams, Property and Acquisition and Construction teams on a number of base station developments.    Able to resolve and work on construction design issues, plus new and the redesign of exisiting towers for their new and othe client Telco rollout projects.

The ideal candidate should have 3 -5  years previous similar project engineering experience, with previous site ofr design exp along with a building or structuralmechanical degree.
Reporting and working from state CBD head offices and liaising with Construction, Project management and design teams.  But you will also need to be able to travel occasionaly to regional and other metro areas to review existing site, monopole, lattice towers, roof top towers.

Permanent roles to $130k neg on exp .     This is a great opportunity to join this growing Telco industry and busy telco team that will continue to grow with more project work over the next 2 years.

If you are working for a construction companies , design consultant or mid range Telco specialist this is a great opportunity for you to move to an international design construct company with career growth while being highly rewarded.   If you are interested in these positions, please send your resume in confidence directly to david.lamb@command.com.au or contact David Lamb or assistant Hannah Kynaston 02 9262 5656.

or you can apply in confidence below

JOB.TITLE: Subsea Project Engineer
JOB.DESCRIPTION: Newly established and headquartered in Perth , our client seeks engineering professionals to join an expanding engineering and project team.
JOB.ADDETAILS:
• Innovative Subsea Operations
     
  • Cutting edge technology
     
  • Exciting , fast paced enviroment

    SUBSEA PROJECT ENGINEERS

    We are looking for a tertiary qualified engineer looking for more interesting, more challenging and more diversified projects than your currently involved in.
    Our client can offer construction, inspection, repair, maintanance, survey, mapping and salvage.

    You will have 4+ years experience in ROV construction and IRM projects for the oil and gas industry.

    An understanding and commitment to HSE and QAQC is essential and you must be prepared for offshore periods of work. Please send your resume to jethro.baker@command.com.au or call on the number below.

JOB.TITLE: Senior Account Channel Manager
JOB.DESCRIPTION: Senior Account Channel Manager URGENT! Virtualisation vendor, SaaS, must have software background, stable employment. $140k inc bonus
JOB.ADDETAILS:
Senior Account Channel Manager URGENT! for this global vendor who is a market leader in the virtualisation space with established accounts in Austrlalia, looking to expand their presence here. They have had amazing financial results over the last 24 months establishing themselves as a powerhouse with this technology. Able to offer stability, career prospects to move into a country manager role and a jet setting lifestyle.

The role will involve managing their distributors and channel here in Australia along with all of their established accounts with room to grow. Representing the company at local industry events, maximising relationships and margins working closely with the Aisa Pacific manager based in China to expand their local presence. There will be an element of business development involved to grow based upon realistic forecasts.

Ideally you will have an established network here in Australia, strong understanding of the vendor margins and channel management along with a proven record of growing local business in the software space. You will have a stable employment record and be looking for a role with a market leader that you can further your career.

Requirements:
  • Degree qualified or equivalent experience
  • Proven track record of growing software sales and accounts in Australia
  • Stable employment background
  • Managed services
  • Ideally Virutalisation
  • Stong communication skills
  • Ambitious


This is a great opportunity to put your mark in an industry with a vendor that is expanding rapidly in the Asia Pacific region. Their is high career growth potential. We are shortlisting immediately so apply not for a confidential chat and immediate interview!

JOB.TITLE: Project Manager / Cost Planner
JOB.DESCRIPTION: Project Manager / Design Manager - Construction - Development - Commercial - Retail -
JOB.ADDETAILS:
Would you like to join one of Melbourne’s most respected, property development, commercial and building management companies - if so then read below;

A specialist in retail, industrial, commercial, sport and recreational projects, my client is looking to engage the services of a Project Manager that comes from a Design background.

Ideally you will need to have experience taking a job from nothing and take it all the way through to completion.

This includes:
  • Forcasting
  • Costing
  • Managing the design process
  • Interfacing with clients


Above all, my client is looking for a professional with high levels of self-motivation, steady employment history and excellent time management with the ability to communicate with staff and clients of all levels alike.

If you feel this is an opportunity that you would like to pursue and you have the relevant work history and industry experience - please send me your updated CV and details to kael.dallaway@command.com.au or you can call me, Kael Dallaway – 9621 3399 – otherwise you can make your application below.

All applicants will be dealt with in a professional manner and with the strictest of confidentiality.


Command Recruitment are a Values Based, specialist-staffing consultancy.

JOB.TITLE: Signalling Engineer
JOB.DESCRIPTION: Major WA Rail Project. Perth based - Exciting new rail major rail project Signalling Engineers needed.
JOB.ADDETAILS:
Our client is currently looking to employ a Signaling Engineer to be based in the Perth CBD office. You will be working through the design process for the rail signaling system. You will be working in a multi-disciplinary team of Engineers, contributing towards the successful delivery of multiple projects of high importance to Perth.

It is expected that you’ve had previous experience within the design phase of major rail projects with an emphasis on signaling. Previous testing and commissioning experience will be a major advantage also. At least 5 years previous experience is prefered.

Position is located in the Perth CBD, with easy public transport available. Good contract or permanent rates are on offer.

For more information please call Daniel Tapper on 9481 1199, email daniel.tapper@command.com.au or apply now.

JOB.TITLE: Business Services - Manager (Mentone) to $120K plus Super
JOB.DESCRIPTION: Free ParkingClose to P/TContinuous career development
JOB.ADDETAILS:
Business Services - Manager

This Practice is a well-established multi disciplinary firm acting as Accountants who specialise in doctors, dentists; self managed superannuation funds and high net worth individuals.

 With 3 partners and over 30 staff this team is expanding fast.You will be located very close to Mentone in modern, open spaced offices that are filled with natural light and show off a gorgeous view of a nearby golf course where free parking is on hand and public transport is only a short walk away.

You will ideally be a qualified Accountant with management experience and strong leadership skills. Your role will include looking after a portfolio of clients along with mentoring and managing a small team of Accountants.

So if you’re ready to take charge of your career and join a team who understands work/life balance and is away from the city, then now is your time to shine!The chosen applicant will have EXCELLENT interpersonal skills and a strong grasp on the English language.

JOB.TITLE: Senior Electrical Primary Engineer : Transmission Substation - CBD
JOB.DESCRIPTION: Exciting opp for snr design or primary engineer to join Multinational Industrial Power division work on excellent $70-500 mil projects
JOB.ADDETAILS:
• The role of Senior Primary Design Engineer switchyard layout, transmission is responsible for all aspects of substation design for indoor and or outdoor substations above 66,000 volts. Typical voltages will be 132kV, 330kV and 500kV. The role will involve green field, and brown field sites of varying size and complexity.
  • You will require skills in protection, control and SCADA equipment selection, coordination, and design to meet relevant Australian design codes and client requirements.
  • You will develop concepts for client review leading to detail documentation for construction.
  • You will be required to work closely with the client and in-house design / CAD staff to produce drawings, schedules, Electrical design .
  • Excellent projects 
  • International with CBD and north shore offcies

    Our client is experiencing growth in this field after winning major alliance project with national power suppliers and are now seeking Engineers with Transmission Substation expereince in design of indoor and outdoor substations.

    They are offering attractive salary in order to attract the right candidates. You would require a minium of 8 to 30 years Electrical design to commissioning of Transmission substations including load calcs, sub station, transformers , mentoring etc.
    If you are interested in this positions, send your resume to David Lamb or Hannah Kynaston at david.lamb@command.com.au. or apply below.

JOB.TITLE: lead Structural Engineer - Process plants : Industrial - $120-150k Sydney
JOB.DESCRIPTION: lead Structural design / project engineer , Oil & Gas, Chemical, materials handling or similar lead industrial plant design-construct exp
JOB.ADDETAILS:
Our client is a specialist consultancy and growing every year while winning major projects and alliances. They are partly owned by a national major oil and gas environment company and are a leader in the design to construct of oil & gas, refinery, process plant and chemical plant and other related process plants, from design to construct.

They require a structural engineer who has experience in some of the following related project work, including -  Process Plant , Power plants, chemical plants, heavy industrial or materials handling plants. Who has worked on steelwork and concrete design of various industrial process plant design with a consultancy or construction company and worked on Oil & Gas process plant or refinery project work .

You would be a lead / Project Structural Design Engineering with around 10 - 25 years of solid heavy industrial structural design experience, with some civil experience and possibly looking at that next career step or moving to a larger specialist company.  Your be able to lead a team and by example, while project managing various projects and while also working on tenders, while reporting and supported by the engineering manager and other senior discipline engineers.
  • Degree qualified is preferred, along with experience. 
  • 8-25 years design experience in similar field. 
  • Familiar with associated structural design software exp 
  • Familiar with all associated Australian standards 
  • Heavy Industrial, Materials Handling or Process Plant structural design experience, including  Steelwork , RC and supports. 
  • Worked in a multidiscipline project office and familiar with a 3D design environment


Great opportunity to work on major projects with in Australia and Asia and work in a large, but friendly busy multi discipline design office environment. Role is based in Sydney west and you will need to occasionally travel interstate or overseas project locations or offices when required.

Attractive salary package would be offered to the right candidate. 

Please contact David Lamb or Hannah Kynaston or forward your resume in total confidence to david.lamb@command.com.au.

 

or apply below

JOB.TITLE: HSE Advisor
JOB.DESCRIPTION: Multi billion dollar greenfield project. EPCM company with ongoing work available.
JOB.ADDETAILS:
• Greenfield Project
  • Multi billion $ Project
  • EPCM Company


The Company

A major EPCM company providing services to a major Australian operating company. With years left in the construction of this particular project it will ensure you are kept busy through the current economic climate.

The Position

As the HSE Advisor on-site in Karratha you will assist management and contractors with the implementation of health, safety, and environmental mangement system to the project. Reporting directly to the HSE Manager, you will provide up to date HSE performance and assist in HSE reviews.

The Candidate

Ideally, you will have excellent communication skills to liase with staff at all levels. You will have apprioximately 5 to 10 years HSE experience in earthworks or hydrocarbon based plants. Furthermore, your working knowledge of PTW systems as applied to a hydrocarbon environment is essential.

JOB.TITLE: Offshore HSEQ Superintendent
JOB.DESCRIPTION: HSEQ Superintendent for offshore FPSO. 3 x 3 roster and excellent contracting rates. Available for immediate start...
JOB.ADDETAILS:
• GOOD CONTRACTING RATES
  • EXCELLENT 3X3 ROSTER
  • ONGOING WORK


REQUIREMENTS

To successfully perform this role you will have offshore HSEQ experience ideally involving work aboard an FPSO or other offshore facility. Additionally a valid HUET and other relevant offshore medical certificates and safety training courses applicable to regular crew working on FPSOs in the designated operating area.

POSITION

The role will see you supervising and reporting on all issues relating to Health, Safety, Environment and Quality. You will essentially be required to administrate and implement the Project Management Plan while providing professional advice to the Project Manager in relating to HSEQ.

EMPLOYER AND PROJECT

The client is a well-known Brownfields Oil and Gas specialist consultancy providing shutdown and capital upgrade services to major operators across WA. They have ongoing work and are continuously securing new work through a quality-tendering department. With a number of projects incorporating some multi billion dollar operations they can ensure you will enjoy secured employment with variety and support.

.

 

DUE TO THE URGENCY OF THIS ROLE ONLY AUSTRALIAN CITIZENS OR PERMANENT RESIDENTS WILL BE CONSIDERED

JOB.TITLE: Site Materials Expeditor Oil and Gas
JOB.DESCRIPTION: FIFO. Major LNG Project. URGENT. Oil and Gas experience essential...
JOB.ADDETAILS:
FIFO
Major LNG EPCM Project
Long stay project
Good contract rates

A rare opportunity has arisen for a site based materials expeditor to work on a good roster; with a strong EPCM on a major LNG project here in WA.
 

You will need to have recent experience working as a materials expeditor in an EPCM environment.


Our EPCM client is currently working on major oil and gas projects in Australia and can provide ongoing work and further opportunities. They have the ability to deliver projects on a quality and timely basis and are always looking for exceptional personnel to join their site based team.
For this position it is essential to have experience as a materials expeditor on a large onshore construction project, ideally on a similar LNG project. Additionally EPCM experience is essential. In return you will be rewarded with a competitive remuneration, bonus retention scheme and job security.
 

Your responsibilities will include:


All purchasing responsibilities for site
Raising of Engineering Requisitions based on Site Instruction for local procurement
Manage and supervise the receiving and issue of materials for the project
Ensure all receipt / warehousing information is accurately maintained
 

 



ONLY THOSE WITH AUSTRALIAN WORK RIGHTS CAN APPLY FOR THIS POSITION

JOB.TITLE: Structural Engineers - Tunnnel or Bridge fo Highway design : New projects!
JOB.DESCRIPTION: Consultancy req's Engineers with tunnel or bridge or highways design exp to work on new awarded infrastructure project.
JOB.ADDETAILS:
Leading consultancy Infrastructure design group requires civil structural design project engineers with Tunneling or Bridge or Roads and Highway experience for the design and layout of new NSW Infrastructure projects.
  •  10-30 years local Civil structural design exp
  •  Familiar with all codes/practices and Australian standards
  •  Perm roles offer attractive salary packages, plus 12 month+ contracts
  •  Familiar with RTA standards
  •  Must have proven Tunnel or Bridge or highway design to construct experience
  •  Familiar with working in a 3D AutoCAD design office environment
  •  Degree qualified or Masters in Civil Structural engineering


Client will offer attractive salary packages and negotiable contract rates and in line with relevant level of associate experience.       Design office is close to all amenities and including major Rail and bus stations.       Please send full resume and cover letter outlining relevant exp to david.lamb@command.com.au  or  call David Lamb and Hannah Kynaston on 02 9262 5656 to discuss - otherwise send your cv only by applying below :-

JOB.TITLE: Bridge Engineer - Highway Project - Sydney consultant $110 - $130K ($75phr)
JOB.DESCRIPTION: Work with busy consultancy project design team on freeway extension and new projects in supportive modern environment
JOB.ADDETAILS:
International known specialist consultancy requires senior - mid level Bridge engineers to work and support bridge design for there Civil Structural Infrastructure division.  You will be responsible for overseeing the Bridge design of this new projects and other various projects, including Rail, roads, highway and other infrastructure projects in NSW , interstate and overseas.  
  • Min 5 -25 years Bridge design and previous retaining and cut and cover structures experience
  • Familiar with working in a busy design team enviornment & liaising with Client, senior management, engineers and drafters.
  • Familiar with relevant software packages
  • Civil structural Engineering degree and associated memberships
  • Worked with a similar design team environment 
  • Positions are permanenet , but will consider contract 

    Our client offers high attractive salary packages with career path and support .
    Great opportunity for an engineer to make that next career move or an engineer who wants to continue to be busy and work on prestige projects and work within a busy and expanding company. 


If you are interested in this role, please send me your full resume in confidence to david.lamb@command.com.au or call David Lamb or Hannah on 02 9262 5656 to discuss

JOB.TITLE: Electrical Power Project Engineer - Energy Transmission - Sydney
JOB.DESCRIPTION: Provide project management/engineering support to Engineering Transmission & Technology Projects with national division
JOB.ADDETAILS:
Australias major Energy power supplier Companies is currently seeking an experienced professional Electrical engineer to support Projects Branch with Electrical engineering and Project management working with a group of designers,  engineers and draftspersons for the design and documentation of new, refurbishment small and large HV substation projects in Australia.

The position will be based in Sydney and report to the Senior Program Engineering Manager.

The successful candidate will have the followings :- 
  • Degree qualified in Electrical Engineering with membership institution of engineers
  • Experience in Electrical HV project design and management towards the construction management / maintenance operation of the disribution for high voltage substations
  • Knowledge and understanding of ACCC and IPART legislation, regulations and policies 
  • Provide Project management / design engineering support for the duration of the projects 
  • Support Project management team/Branch and report to Snr Program Manager
  • High degree of independence and responsibility for making site decisions
  • Ensure that all necessary reviews, verifications and validations of project plans
  • Ensure the conformation to all safety, environmental, construction, commissioning, and operating requirements,
  • Provides all necessary support to the procurement, construction, commissioning and design teams and Monitor external design consultants to ensure that the elements of their design are coordinated
  • Liaise with all relevant Divisions, Authorities on design team
  • Monitor and control timeliness of outputs and design costs within budget and liaise with the Project Manager in relation to any design changes,
  • Prepare a project Close-out Report at the end of the project.


Great position for someone wanting to utilise there skills at this level and work for a company that is supportive and has conistant but various project work to keep it as the national leader. 

If you are interested in these positions, please send your resume in confidence to david.lamb@command.com.au or call David and Hannah on 02 9262 5656
